result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea K Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 15cf1471.
1-25-16: Def is entitled to 5 days sentence credit.
9/13/17 Crt extends probation for 1 yr or until Anger Management programming (if deemed appropriate by agent based upon behavior after 9/13/17) and 40 hrs of community service are completed.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015.
Completion of aggression/anger management counseling.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

of conviction. 
Crt extends probation for 1 yr or until Anger Management programming (if deemed appropriate by agent based upon behavior after 9/13/17) and 40 hrs of community service are completed.     Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.

Defendant appeared.  Allison E. Cogbill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Chelsey Keen, not at counsel table, in court. DE has not completed community service and anger management classes. DE claims she completed the community service. Ct does not deem community service completed and DE informed she needs to complete the community service requirement. Ct extends supervision for 1 year. Anger management to be left up to agent with conditions stated on record. Early termination of probation with completion of community service and decision as to anger management by agent.
